subject: I Hate Football
event:
Life is miserable and full of pain.

A truly wretched day of football today.  Both of my teams sucked big time.

Hard to say which was the most miserable performance.  Eli played pretty well for the Giants, but his receivers dropped every ball he threw at them, as if they were determined to prove that, yes, the team will miss Plaxico big time.  In the afternoon game, well, the Jet offense was okay, but the defense couldn't stop the 49ers.  They just marched up and down the field at will.  Singletary has that team playing much harder than Nolan did.  The Jets game also had some truly awful and one-sided officiating by Ed Hochuli and his crew.  The turning point of the contest may well have been when Leon Washington's long return for a TD was called back on a phantom holding call.  I don't know what's happened to Hochuli.  In past years, he's been one of the NFL's best refs, but this year he and his crew have been terrible.  It seems as if they blow a call every week... and a BIG call at that.  Not that the Jets did not deserve to lose.  These last two weeks, they've been playing as if they thought the season ended with the Titans game.

Pfui.

comments.article:
Buck up!
As a fellow Giants fan it is sad to see them lose but teams have off days and that is definitely the case here. Look for a rally next week.

Somone might have said this before (I don't genreally read the comments in response to yuour posts) but...

It could be worse. You could be a Detroit Lions fan.
No more Millen. The draft should be better.
comments.subject: Silver Lining...

comments.article: As aggravated as i was with the Giants loss, I am happy to say with the Steelers win over the Cowboys they did clinch their division. I foresee they will be regrouped and ready to pound the Cowboys next week as well :) As for Plaxico being a factor in how they have been playing recently, in my honest opinion he isn't.
comments.subject: bright spot in the gloom

comments.article:
You think your teams sucked today?!

The best part about today was that the beer was cold.
The Steelers beat the hated Cowboys today... woohoo!
comments.subject: at least

comments.article: giants didn't come to play today.  Nice effort by Eli though, I wish he had some help.

As a Cowboys fan, it's hard to feel bad for the Giants today. The Boys dominated that game until there were 6 mins left in the 4th quarter. And at the end of the day the G-men still clinched the division.

The Jets, that one is tough. Everytime they look like they have everything together, they take steps backwards. They are like Jeckle and Hyde.
Dallas lost, so the giants indirectly clinched the division.  That should make life a little less miserable and full of pain.
Aw... Comeon... you REALLY don't hate football!  When its over you will totally miss it! :-)

I watched that Giants game, then watched my beloved Bills SUCK with JP blowing every single chance that came his way.

A bad day all 'round for NY football.

i missed the jets, thank goodness, because i would have been a heap of misery. i did see the giants, and it was so brutal that even my mum, who HATES the giants, felt bad for me.

oog.
deepest sympathy.
comments.subject: You have my

comments.article:
I'm not sad the Giants lost.

I'm glad Dallas lost.

and I'm happy the Skins are losing at the 1/2 14-0


anything to make Philly's chances a little better please.
comments.subject: Sorry GRRM...dont kill me but..

comments.article: I'd add my w00t, but ulfric, we both know deep down that it's too little, too late.
comments.subject: Re: Sorry GRRM...dont kill me but..

comments.article:
A sad week from the viewpoint of a NY football fan, but the silver lining is the Giants are in the playoffs not matter what, and the jets can still get a spot as well.

And now ....

The Pittsburgh Steelers once again proved that defense wins championships not matter how an offense sputters. I believe we had an arrangement, Mr. Martin, concerning the Steelers beating the Cowboys. I have delivered.
comments.subject: I hate to poke the bear with a stick, but ......

comments.article:
I'm Ed Hochulis' biggest fan.

And hell, how good are both the NFC and AFC East are this year? Insane...if my wounded but playoff bound Broncos played in the NFC East I'm afraid they'd be 3-10, not 8-5.

comments.upictitle: Jeanne / Xaviara al'Nady / Tita Kini: PolarBear
comments.article: Singletary is trying to earn the permanent job at the helm of the 49ers and at this rate I sure hope he gets it.

I agree - I don't think Jets fans should feel any worse than usual about this loss. The 9ers played a solid game in all three phases and would have been competitive with any team in the NFL (just for today) Singletary does have them playing hard, and he has the offense and defense playing together as a team. Too many teams play as if O and D aren't even on the same field.

GRRM does have a point about the officiating though, I didn't see anything too bad on the Leon Washington TD - though they did take a TD away from the 9ers as well.

9ers can help the Jets next week at Miami - Jets fans ought to be rooting for them now.
comments.subject: Singletary

comments.article: I feel your pain, George.  My Seahawks played well for the first 3-1/2 quarters, then found a way to lose again,to Evil Little Bill and his Pats.  2-11 and in the Abyss of the NFC Worst.  The only bright spot to the season is we still play the Rams one more time.

As a Ice and Fire fan, I regret your disappointment with today's results, however, as a life-long Dolphins fan, I am elated. Except for Seattle's inevitable collapse, of course.

Looking forward to the last game of the season, hope it is for the division!
comments.subject: I love Football

comments.article:
As alongtime suffering 49er fan (well it feels long) at last there might be a breath of fresh air on the horizon. Mike Singletary seems to be motivating the players. If only they could have hung in there to win the Cardinals game, they would actually be in playoff contention. Also good that the Washington Rednecks are losing.

Anyways, to me the strongest team at the moment seems to be the Pittsburh Steelers. Potential Super Bowl winners.
comments.subject: Go Niners

comments.article:
Giants. As a fan you had to see this one coming.
This was the first cold windy winter game at Giant Stadium in over a season. Giants play calling both on offense and defense lacked conviction. And, yes the media and public maelstrom around the Plaxico/Pierce situation played a part. During this past week they simply didn't appear or sound like the relaxed and confident team as they had been all season long. Give the Eagles credit. Westbrook is lethal when healthy. Their offensive line played stellar ball on run and pass. McNabb has his babies (didn't know about that) and is managing rather than trying to be the hero. It's a good thing that they have that "1". They could make Superbowl noise if the unlikely happens and they make the playoffs.

Good news. Plax has left the building and Pierce has immunity and after Monday it will be football as normal for the G-Men. Don't get giddy. The 'Boys look like they are peaking too. They scare me more than any other team in the NFL. Oh, one more complaint. Why, Oh why, did they elect to receive at the start of the game? Well I guess we could blame global warming. They are out of practice with bad Giant Stadium weather. The Giants always take the wind advantage in the fourth quarter. Not that it would have made a tremendous difference today.

Jets. Paul Maguire. Oh no, not again. Really. I hope they turn it around. I blame Mannotsogenious. Keep It Simple S.....
comments.subject: Re: bright spot in the gloom

comments.article:
I grew up a Colts fan.
Not the last few years, I'm talking 90-99.
I feel your pain.

From my perspective as a Niners fan, it was a great Sunday. They are finally playing with life again. They're certainly nowhere near the top teams in the league in terms of talent, but they do have a core group of good players - Gore and Willis foremost - and Shaun Hill is a gamer. Most of all Singletary is motivating them in a way Nolan clearly couldn't. I'm finally looking forward to Sundays again.

As for the call, yes, it was a phantom, but the holding call that reversed a Niners TD (moments earlier) was nearly as bad. The Niners outplayed the Jets, in all three phases, and deserved the win.

I don't dislike the Jets, so I hope the Niners beat Miami next week and help you out.

I'd dole out some sympathy, but I'm a Chiefs' fan.

I've got to admit that they are losing less painfully lately. See what I have to hold onto? Being happy that my team loses gracefully...

I am still pulling for this scenario and with both teams guaranteed playoff spots we are one step closer. As a Titans fan, I hope if it does happen you will be the one upset that day instead of me. However, if the Titans got to the big game and lost to the Giants, it wouldn't be as hard as them losing to a team I hate... like the Eagles.
comments.subject: Giants vs. Titans
